text.0: naught is today tomorrow naught who comprehends the mystery.
text.1: we must address ourselves unto anothers thought and lost is then the hope we formed.
text.2: the maruts are thy brothers why o indra wouldst thou take our lives.
text.3: agree with them in friendly wise and do not slay us in the fight.
text.4: agastya brother why dost thou neglect us thou who art our friend.
text.5: we know the nature of thy mind verity thou wilt give us naught.
text.6: let them prepare the altar let them kindle fire in front we two.
text.7: here will spread sacrifice for thee that the immortal may observe.
text.8: thou lord of wealth art master of all treasures thou lord of friends art thy friends best supporter.
text.9: o indra speak thou kindly with the maruts and taste oblations in their proper season.
